revision.text:
{{Use mdy dates|date=December 2013}} {{Infobox person | name = Olivia Palermo | image = Oliva Palermo - Flickr - nick step.jpg | imagesize = | caption = Palermo in 2010 | birth_name = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1986|2|28}} | birth_place = [[New York City, New York]], U.S. | death_date = | death_place = | nationality = American | occupation = Fashion influencer • entrepreneur | spouse = {{marriage|Johannes Huebl|2014}} | website = {{ConditionalURL}} }}
'''Olivia Palermo''' (born February 28, 1986) is an American [[socialite]], [[fashion influencer]] and [[Entrepreneurship|entrepreneur]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/olivia-palermo-the-ultimate-social-media-influencer-fhj77jdlg|title=Olivia Palermo: the ultimate social-media influencer|last=Rose|first=Hilary|date=2016-12-03|work=The Times|access-date=2019-08-02|language=en|issn=0140-0460}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://wwd.com/fashion-news/fashion-features/karl-lagerfeld-taps-olivia-palermo-to-style-looks-from-fall-collection-1203020722/|title=EXCLUSIVE: Karl Lagerfeld Taps Olivia Palermo to Style Fall Looks|last=Diderich|first=Joelle|date=2019-02-13|website=WWD|language=en|access-date=2019-08-02}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.flare.com/fashion/olivia-palermo-interview-banana-republic/|title=Watch: Olivia Palermo Shares Her Best Fall Fashion Hacks - Video Flare|website=www.flare.com|access-date=2019-08-02}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.smh.com.au/entertainment/celebrity/selling-clothes-out-in-minutes-olivia-palermo-is-leading-the-next-generation-of-style-20170323-gv4cy7.html|title=How Olivia Palermo can sell out clothes in minutes|last=Mulkerrins|first=Jane|date=2017-03-23|website=The Sydney Morning Herald|language=en|access-date=2018-05-14}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.standard.co.uk/fashion/news/olivia-palermo-talks-reality-tv-the-price-of-fashion-and-her-struggle-growing-up-with-a-learning-a3509256.html|title=Olivia Palermo on her struggle growing up with a learning disability|work=Evening Standard|access-date=2018-05-14|language=en-GB}}</ref> Palermo gained celebrity when she sued socialiterank.com for releasing a letter that was proved to be false. It made a news story on [[New York Magazine]] on May 4, 2007.<ref name=nymag />
== Early life == Palermo was born in [[New York City]] and grew up on the [[Upper East Side]] and in [[Greenwich, Connecticut]]. Her father is a real estate developer and her mother is an interior designer. She has a younger brother, Grant.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/14/fashion/olivia-palermo-fashion.html|title=Olivia Palermo got a lot out of that internship|first=Steven|last=Kurutz|publisher=The New York Times|date=2020-01-14|accessdate=2020-04-12}}</ref> Palermo attended elementary school at [[Nightingale-Bamford School]] in Manhattan and high school at the [[St. Luke's School (Connecticut)|St. Luke's School]] in [[New Canaan, Connecticut]]. She attended the [[American University of Paris]] and [[The New School]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://observer.com/2015/02/the-independent-state-of-palermo/|title=Olivia Palermo On Building a Brand|date=2015-02-11|work=Observer|access-date=2018-05-14|language=en-US}}</ref> She is of [[Italian people|Italian]] descent. Palermo grew up with a learning disability.<ref name="independent.ie">{{cite web|url=https://www.independent.ie/style/celebrity/celebrity-news/olivia-palermo-everything-was-harder-for-me-because-i-grew-up-with-a-learning-disability-35679836.html|title=Olivia Palermo: 'Everything was harder for me because I grew up with a learning disability'|first=Sasha|last=Brady|publisher=The Independent|date=2017-05-04|accessdate=2020-04-12}}</ref> Palermo interned at [[Quest (lifestyle magazine)|''Quest'']] magazine.<ref name=nymag>{{citation |work= [[New York Magazine]] |url= https://nymag.com/news/people/31555/ |title= The Number-One Girl |date= May 7, 2007 |accessdate= November 4, 2009 |first=Isaiah |last=Wilner }}</ref> Photographer [[Patrick McMullan]] spotted her at an auction, then took pictures of her about town. Palermo began taking part in the charity event circuit in New York, becoming a member of the Friends Committee of New Yorkers For Children and joining the committee of [[Operation Smile]].<ref name=nymag/><ref name=vogue>{{cite web |first= Dolly |last= Jones |url= http://www.vogue.co.uk/biographies/100406-olivia-palermo-biography.aspx |title= Olivia Palermo biography (Vogue.com UK) |magazine= Vogue.co.uk |date= February 10, 2010 |accessdate= August 31, 2010}}</ref>
==Career== Palermo began her career as part of MTV's television show, ''[[The City (2008 TV series)|The City]]''.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/2037376/olivia-palermo-the-city-reveals-off-camera/|title=Olivia Palermo Reveals What The Cameras DIDN'T Show On 'The City'|work=MTV News|access-date=2018-07-13|language=en}}</ref> The series aired for two seasons from 2008 until 2010, and focused on the personal and professional lives of several young women residing in New York City.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://ew.com/article/2010/10/25/the-city-canceled-whitney-port-tells-ryan-seacrest-its-over/|title='The City' canceled? Whitney Port tells Ryan Seacrest it's over|work=EW.com|access-date=2018-07-13|language=en}}</ref> As part of the show, Palermo worked for [[Diane von Fürstenberg]] and later in the accessories department for ''[[Elle (magazine)|Elle]]'' magazine.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/showtracker/2009/03/the-city-olivia.html|title='The City': Olivia Palermo says she's 'disappointed' being the villain|date=2009-03-10|website=LA Times Blogs - Show Tracker|language=en-US|access-date=2018-07-13}}</ref>
In 2009, Palermo signed with the talent agency [[Wilhelmina Models|Wilhelmina International Inc.]] to focus full-time on development of her brand.<ref>{{citation|last=Jessen|first=Monique|title=Olivia Palermo Joins Wilhelmina Modeling Agency!|date=June 23, 2009|url=http://stylenews.peoplestylewatch.com/2009/06/23/olivia-palermo-joins-wilhelmina-modeling-agency/|publisher=[[Time Inc.]]|accessdate=November 5, 2009}}</ref> She became a guest editor for the Gap's now-defunct [[Piperlime]].com in 2011 and appeared as a guest judge on ''[[Project Runway]]'' Season 9.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.whowhatwear.com/olivia-palermo-piperlime-spring-picks-2014|title=Exclusive: Piperlime Guest Editor Olivia Palermo Shares Her Spring Must-Haves|work=Who What Wear|access-date=2018-05-16|language=en-us}}</ref><ref>{{Citation|last=Spirko|first=Craig|title=Sew '70s|date=2011-09-29|url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt2076613/|others=Heidi Klum, Tim Gunn, Michael Kors|accessdate=2018-05-16}}</ref> In 2010, Palermo modeled for the Autumn/Winter campaigns by [[Mango (clothing)|Mango]] and [[Tod's|Hogan]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://nymag.com/daily/fashion/2010/09/olivia_palermo_and_her_boyfrie.html|title=Olivia Palermo and Her Boyfriend to Star Alongside Scarlett Johansson As the Faces of Mango – The Cut|last=Odell|first=Amy|date=February 29, 2012|publisher=Nymag.com|accessdate=March 11, 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://style.mtv.com/2010/08/23/olivia-palermo-hogan-photo/|title=Photo: See Olivia Palermo Model For Hogan!|date=August 23, 2010|publisher=Style.mtv.com|accessdate=March 11, 2012}}</ref> In October 2011, Palermo launched her personal website, which consists of editorial content about fashion, beauty and lifestyle written by full-time writers and contributing editors.<ref name="exposed">{{cite web|url=http://exposedzippers.com/olivia-palermo|title=Olivia Palermo|date=October 17, 2011|publisher=ExposedZippers|accessdate=March 11, 2012}}</ref> She also appeared as a guest judge on ''[[Britain's Next Top Model|Britain and Ireland's Next Top Model]]'' Season 7.<ref>{{Citation|title=Episode #7.10|date=2011-09-05|url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt2069190/|others=Elle Macpherson, Fearne Cotton, Julien MacDonald Adler|accessdate=2018-05-16}}</ref> Later in 2012, the ''[[New York Post]]'' named Palermo as the best dressed New Yorker of [[Page Six]].<ref>"Flashback 2012: Olivia Palermo Named Page Six’s Best Dressed New Yorker | Oregon Prep & Liberal." Oregon Prep & Liberal. Web. Feb 8, 2014.</ref><ref>"Olivia Palermo dolls it up - New York Post." YouTube. Web. Feb 8, 2014.</ref> Palermo appeared on the August 2018 cover of ''[[Glamour (magazine)|Glamour]]'' Mexico and has shot editorials for magazines, including ''[[Grazia]]'' Australia and ''¡Hola! Fashion Magazine''.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://oliviapalermo.com/olivia-for-grazia-australia/|title=Olivia for Grazia Australia {{!}} Olivia Palermo|website=oliviapalermo.com|language=en-US|access-date=2018-11-03}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://oliviapalermo.com/bts-olivia-x-hola-magazine/?slide=2|title=BTS: Olivia x ¡Hola! Fashion Magazine {{!}} Olivia Palermo|website=oliviapalermo.com|language=en-US|access-date=2018-11-03}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://oliviapalermo.com/olivia-for-glamour-mexico/?slide=1|title=Olivia for GLAMOUR Mexico {{!}} Olivia Palermo|website=oliviapalermo.com|language=en-US|access-date=2018-11-03}}</ref> She was also on the cover of ''[[Cosmopolitan (magazine)|Cosmopolitan]]'', ''[[InStyle]]'', ''[[Elle (magazine)|Elle]]'', ''[[Flare (magazine)|Flare]]'', ''[[Marie Claire]]'', ''[[Arcadia (magazine)|Arcadia]]'', ''[[Lucky (magazine)|Lucky]]'', ''[[Brides (magazine)|Brides]]'', ''[[Harper's Bazaar]]'', ''[[L'Officiel]]'', ''[[Tatler]]'' and ''[[Stella (Norwegian magazine)|Stella]]''.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://oliviasstyle.blogspot.com/2015/04/olivia-palermo-magazine-covers.html|title=The Olivia Palermo Lookbook : Olivia Palermo Magazine Covers|last=Martins|first=Marta|date=2015-04-30|website=The Olivia Palermo Lookbook|access-date=2018-11-03}}</ref> Palermo has been the face of mid-range brands such as Aerin, Max&Co, and Banana Republic.<ref name="independent.ie"/>
=== Co-branded partnerships ===
In 2010, Palermo launched a co-branded, limited jewelry collection with Roberta Freymann and became the face of the Mediterraneo collection by Spanish jewelry brand [[Carrera y Carrera]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.refinery29.com/roberta-by-olivia-palermos-bib-necklaces-are-now-available-on-matches|title=Roberta By Olivia Palermo's Bib Necklaces Are Now Available On Matches|access-date=2018-05-16|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.instyle.com/2011/07/29/lady-gaga-olivia-palermo-more/ |title=Lady Gaga – Olivia Palermo – Carrera y Carrera : InStyle.com What's Right Now |publisher=News.instyle.com |date=July 29, 2011 |accessdate=March 11, 2012}}</ref> In August 2011, Palermo was invited by [[Stuart Weitzman]] to design a shoe for charity.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.vogue.co.uk/gallery/olivia-palermo-stuart-weitzman-collaboration|title=Palermo Designs|last=Alexander|first=Ella|website=www.vogue.co.uk|access-date=2018-05-17}}</ref> Later in 2014, she designed a line of sunglasses for American brand Westward Leaning, and a percentage of each sale went to support the Association for Development, Alternative Commerce, and Micro Credits's Masaai Project.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://people.com/style/olivia-palermo-designs-collection-for-westward-leaning-sunglasses/|title=Olivia Palermo Designs Collection for Westward Leaning Sunglasses|work=PEOPLE.com|access-date=2018-05-16|language=en}}</ref><ref>[http://maasai.pikolinos.com/ Pikolinos: Maasai]. Maasai.pikolinos.com. Retrieved on December 30, 2013.</ref> Also in 2014, Palermo collaborated with Italian shoe label Aquazzura on a line of footwear.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.vogue.co.uk/article/olivia-palermo-shoe-designer-collaboration-aquazzura|title=Palermo Turns Shoe Designer|last=Kilcooley-O'Halloran|first=Scarlett|access-date=2018-05-17}}</ref>[[File:Olivia Palermo Milan Fashion Week Autumn Winter 2019.jpg|thumb|Palermo at [[Milan Fashion Week]] Autumn/Winter, 2019|290x290px]]In 2015, Palermo collaborated on collections with luxury leather and accessories brand [[Aspinal of London]], the American jewelry and accessories brand Baublebar, and makeup company Ciaté London.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.elle.com/fashion/celebrity-style/news/a27561/olivia-palermo-handbag-designer/|title=Olivia Palermo Adds Handbag Designer to Her Resume|date=2015-03-31|work=ELLE|access-date=2018-05-17|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.elle.com/fashion/accessories/g27000/olivia-palermo-baublebar-collection/|title=Exclusive: See Olivia Palermo's Full BaubleBar Collection|date=2015-09-29|work=ELLE|access-date=2018-05-17|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.harpersbazaar.com/beauty/makeup/a11845/exclusive-olivia-palermo-ciate-london-makeup-collection/|title=Exclusive: First Look at the Olivia Palermo x Ciaté London Makeup Collection|date=2015-08-11|work=Harper's BAZAAR|access-date=2018-05-17|language=en-US}}</ref> Palermo's collaboration with Ciaté featured a line of makeup and nail polish, including a shade of red inspired by her mother. She went on to partner with [[Nordstrom]] on a fashion line in 2016 and with [[Banana Republic]] in 2017.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://press.nordstrom.com/phoenix.zhtml?c=211996&p=irol-newsArticle&ID=2136399|title=Nordstrom Launches Exclusive 'Olivia Palermo + Chelsea28' Collection - Press Room - Nordstrom.com|website=press.nordstrom.com|access-date=2018-05-17}}</ref><ref name=":0"/> In 2017, Palermo worked with accessory brand Meli Melo on a collection title, ''Severine''. The London brand, known for their high-quality materials and craftsmanship, collaborated with Palermo to create a modern spin on a bucket bag. The bag, which came in five different shades, was modeled after the sculptural works of late architect and artist, [[Max Bill]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://oliviapalermo.com/olivia-palermo-x-meli-melo-collection/|title=Olivia Palermo x Meli Melo Collection {{!}} Olivia Palermo|website=oliviapalermo.com|language=en-US|access-date=2018-10-30}}</ref>
=== Brand ambassadorships === Palermo was named the brand ambassador of the 2013 and 2014 Maasai Project for Pikolinos.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/sboyd/2014/09/20/stylish-sips-with-style-icon-olivia-palermo/#44f0663f8ea5|title=Stylish Sips With Style Icon Olivia Palermo|last=Boyd|first=Sarah|work=Forbes|access-date=2018-05-16|language=en}}</ref> In September 2016, [[Banana Republic]] announced Palermo as the brand's first Women's Global Style Ambassador through 2017.<ref name=":0">[http://www.gapinc.com/content/gapinc/html/media/pressrelease/2016/med_pr_br_turnitup_9916.html Banana Republic Announces Olivia Palermo As Global Style Ambassador] Press Release - Gap Inc.; September 9, 2016</ref>
== Personal life == Palermo married German model Johannes Huebl in June 2014.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.latimes.com/entertainment/gossip/la-et-mg-olivia-palermo-wedding-johannes-huebl-marriage-20140630-story.html|title=Olivia Palermo marries Johannes Huebl, rocks shorts on her big day|last=Saad|first=Nardine|website=latimes.com|access-date=2018-05-17}}</ref>
==Filmography== {| class="wikitable" ! colspan="4" |Film and television roles |- ! Year ! Title ! Role ! Notes |- |2008–10 |''[[The City (2008 TV series)|The City]]'' |Herself |35 episodes |- |2011 |''[[Britain's Next Top Model]]'' |Herself |Episode: "Episode #7.10" |- |2011 |''[[Project Runway]]'' |Herself / Guest Judge |Episode: "Sew '70s" |- |2011 |''[[The Smurfs (film)|The Smurfs]]'' |Party Guest |Film |- |}
